# Introduction {#sec-introduction}

- motivation for understanding randomness
- role of "statistics"
- this book will give theoretical foundations
- dive deep in a few directions so you have the skills to generalize
- focus on simulation


Dealing with data inevitably involves coming to terms with *randomness*.
Learn things from data involves two things:
measuring quantities of interest,
and then figuring out what those measurements mean about the wider world.


## Who is this book for

- prerequisites: computing, math
- you've got experience working with data
- give you the skills to find, understand and evaluate new tools
